examgrader.controllers

Class MainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • examgrader.controllers.MainController

  • public class MainController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls all interaction between ExamGrader's gui and model. Stores all data as a List of Students and List of Exams and contains methods for interacting with them. Also contains methods for file input and output.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MainController()
      Initializes the list of Students and list of Exams.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainController

        public MainController()
        Initializes the list of Students and list of Exams. Also detects directory for existing save data.

    • Method Detail

      • getStudents

        public java.util.List<Student> getStudents()
        Returns:
        a list of all Students stored

      • getExams

        public java.util.List<Exam> getExams()
        Returns:
        a list of all Exams stored

      • getStudent

        public Student getStudent(java.lang.String id)
        Returns a student matching the specified student ID. Returns null if not found.
        Parameters:
        id - Student id to match
        Returns:
        a student matching the specified student ID, null if not found.

      • getExam

        public Exam getExam(java.lang.String name)
        Returns an Exam matching the specified Exam name. Returns null if not found.
        Parameters:
        name - Exam name to match
        Returns:
        an Exam matching the specified Exam name, null if not found.

      • addStudent

        public void addStudent(Student s)
        Adds a new Student to the controller's Student list. Checks to see if student already is in the list and does not add if so

      • deleteStudent

        public void deleteStudent(Student s)
        Removes a Student from the program, including any data associated with them. Deletes their answers to all Exams and then removes them from the controller's list of Students.
        Parameters:
        s - Student to be removed

      • addExam

        public void addExam(Exam e)
        Parameters:
        e - New Exam to be added to the controller's list of exams

      • deleteExam

        public void deleteExam(Exam e)
        Removes an Exam from the program, including any data associated with it. Calls the deleteExam(e) method on all Students to remove the exam from each one of them as well.
        Parameters:
        e - Exam to be deleted

      • loadStudentExams

        public java.util.List<StudentExam> loadStudentExams(java.lang.String filename,
                                                    Exam exam)
        Reads in StudentExams from a file and returns them as a List. Creates new Student objects for those that don't exist in the program yet and adds them to the controller's list of Students.
        Parameters:
        filename - Absolute path + filename for the file containing the StudentExams to be added
        exam - Exam associated with the new StudentExams
        Returns:
        List of StudentExams created from the given file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file can't be found or an error occurs when parsing it

      • writeResultsFile

        public void writeResultsFile(java.lang.String filename,
                             java.util.List<StudentExam> results)
        Writes a list of StudentExams to a file. File is formatted as a comma-separated values (CSV) file. Format is: Exam Name, First, Last, Id, Score, Questions Overwrites file if it already exists.
        Parameters:
        filename - Absolute path + filename of the file to be created.
        results - List of StudentExams to write to the file.

      • loadExamKey

        public ExamKey loadExamKey(java.lang.String filename,
                           java.lang.String examName)
        Reads an ExamKey in from the specified file. Input file is formatted as a list of answers, separated by commas.
        Parameters:
        filename - Absolute path + filename of the file to be read
        examName - Name of the exam associated with the ExamKey
        Returns:
        a new ExamKey object from the file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file can't be found or an error occurs when parsing it

      • clearAllData

        public void clearAllData()
        Clears all data stored in the program. Creates new blank lists for Exams and Students

      • saveState

        public void saveState()
        Saves all program data to a file (savestate.ser) in the save-data folder of the program's main directory. The controller's list of Students and list of Exams are serialized and written to a binary file that can be loaded later.

      • loadSavedState

        public void loadSavedState()
        Checks for save data in the file save-data\savestate.ser and loads it if it exists. Loads a list of Exams and a list of Students for the controller.
